name: MoSCoW Template for Conversational Design (Chatbots or Voicebots)
description:
Use this template to discuss with your team and focus on the most important requirements, features, and work efforts for your upcoming conversational project.


The MoSCoW method is a prioritization framework. Is used as a technique to reach a common understanding with stakeholders, and guide discussions to prioritize features, and work efforts.


To use this, get the team together, explain the WHY, PRODUCT VISION, and PRODUCT BRIEF, then fill each quadrant with the features and deliverables that will help the team to develop the project.


To briefly explain each quadrant: 


✔️ Must-have: requirements that are the expected outcome


✔️ Should-have: requirements that will have an impact, but the product can work without them


✔️ Could-have: desirable requirements


✔️ Won't-have: requirements the team will not do on or focus on this cycle.


Built to give back to the community. ✌️

Please share any feedback to hello@caiocalado.com
